refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GVolume interface represents user-visible objects that can be mounted. Note, when porting from GnomeVFS, GVolume is the moral equivalent of GnomeVFSDrive.

Mounting a GVolume instance is an asynchronous operation. For more information about asynchronous operations, see GAsyncResult and GTask. To mount a GVolume, first call g_volume_mount() with (at least) the GVolume instance, optionally a GMountOperation object and a GAsyncReadyCallback.

Typically, one will only want to pass NULL for the GMountOperation if automounting all volumes when a desktop session starts since it's not desirable to put up a lot of dialogs asking for credentials.

The callback will be fired when the operation has resolved (either with success or failure), and a GAsyncReady structure will be passed to the callback. That callback should then call g_volume_mount_finish() with the GVolume instance and the GAsyncReady data to see if the operation was completed successfully. If an error is present when g_volume_mount_finish() is called, then it will be filled with any error information.

refsect3.title: Volume Identifiers
refsect3.para: It is sometimes necessary to directly access the underlying operating system object behind a volume (e.g. for passing a volume to an application via the commandline). For this purpose, GIO allows to obtain an 'identifier' for the volume. There can be different kinds of identifiers, such as Hal UDIs, filesystem labels, traditional Unix devices (e.g. /dev/sda2), UUIDs. GIO uses predefined strings as names for the different kinds of identifiers: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UUID, G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_LABEL, etc. Use g_volume_get_identifier() to obtain an identifier for a volume.

Note that G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_HAL_UDI will only be available when the gvfs hal volume monitor is in use. Other volume monitors will generally be able to provide the G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UNIX_DEVICE identifier, which can be used to obtain a hal device by means of libhal_manager_find_device_string_match().

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name of volume .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the name for the given volume . The returned string should be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_uuid ()
refsect2.para: Gets the UUID for the volume . The reference is typically based on the file system UUID for the volume in question and should be considered an opaque string. Returns NULL if there is no UUID available.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the UUID for volume or NULL if no UUID can be computed. The returned string should be freed with g_free() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the icon for volume .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GIcon. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_symbolic_icon ()
refsect2.para: Gets the symbolic icon for volume .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GIcon. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.34

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_drive ()
refsect2.para: Gets the drive for the volume .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GDrive or NULL if volume is not associated with a drive. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_mount ()
refsect2.para: Gets the mount for the volume .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GMount or NULL if volume isn't mounted. The returned object should be unreffed with g_object_unref() when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_volume_can_mount ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a volume can be mounted.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the volume can be mounted. FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: g_volume_should_automount ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the volume should be automatically mounted.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the volume should be automatically mounted

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_activation_root ()
refsect2.para:
Gets the activation root for a GVolume if it is known ahead of mount time. Returns NULL otherwise. If not NULL and if volume
is mounted, then the result of g_mount_get_root() on the GMount object obtained from g_volume_get_mount() will always either be equal or a prefix of what this function returns. In other words, in code
then the expression
will always be TRUE.
Activation roots are typically used in GVolumeMonitor implementations to find the underlying mount to shadow, see g_mount_is_shadowed() for more details.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the activation root of volume or NULL. Use g_object_unref() to free.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.18

refsect2.title: g_volume_mount ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_volume_mount (GVolume *volume, GMountMountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Mounts a volume. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_volume_mount_finish() with the volume
and GAsyncResult returned in the callback .
Virtual: mount_fn

entry.para: a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
user data that gets passed to callback

refsect2.title: g_volume_mount_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes mounting a volume. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

If the mount operation succeeded, g_volume_get_mount() on volume
is guaranteed to return the mount right after calling this function; there's no need to listen for the 'mount-added' signal on GVolumeMonitor.

entry.para: a GError location to store an error, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: g_volume_can_eject ()
refsect2.para: Checks if a volume can be ejected.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the volume can be ejected. FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: g_volume_eject ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_volume_eject (GVolume *volume, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);

warning.para: g_volume_eject has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
Ejects a volume. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_volume_eject_finish() with the volume
and GAsyncResult returned in the callback .

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for eject
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.
user data that gets passed to callback

refsect2.title: g_volume_eject_finish ()

warning.para: g_volume_eject_finish has been deprecated since version 2.22 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Finishes ejecting a volume. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store an error, or NULL to ignore

refsect2.title: g_volume_eject_with_operation ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_volume_eject_with_operation (GVolume *volume, GMountUnmountFlags flags, GMountOperation *mount_operation, GCancellable *cancellable, GAsyncReadyCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para:
Ejects a volume. This is an asynchronous operation, and is finished by calling g_volume_eject_with_operation_finish() with the volume
and GAsyncResult data returned in the callback .

entry.para: flags affecting the unmount if required for eject
a GMountOperation or NULL to avoid user interaction.
optional GCancellable object, NULL to ignore.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: g_volume_eject_with_operation_finish ()
refsect2.para: Finishes ejecting a volume. If any errors occurred during the operation, error will be set to contain the errors and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GError location to store the error occurring, or NULL

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the volume was successfully ejected. FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 2.22

refsect2.title: g_volume_enumerate_identifiers ()
refsect2.para: Gets the kinds of identifiers that volume has. Use g_volume_get_identifier() to obtain the identifiers themselves.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a NULL-terminated array of strings containing kinds of identifiers. Use g_strfreev() to free.

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_identifier ()
refsect2.para: Gets the identifier of the given kind for volume . See the introduction for more information about volume identifiers.

entry.para: the kind of identifier to return

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated string containing the requested identifier, or NULL if the GVolume doesn't have this kind of identifier.

refsect2.title: g_volume_get_sort_key ()
refsect2.para: Gets the sort key for volume , if any.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Sorting key for volume or NULL if no such key is available.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: GVolume
refsect2.para: Opaque mountable volume object.

refsect2.title: struct GVolumeIface
refsect2.para: Interface for implementing operations for mountable volumes.

entry.para: Changed signal that is emitted when the volume's state has changed.
The removed signal that is emitted when the GVolume have been removed. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.
Gets a string containing the name of the GVolume.
Gets a GIcon for the GVolume.

Gets the UUID for the GVolume. The reference is typically based on the file system UUID for the mount in question and should be considered an opaque string. Returns NULL if there is no UUID available.
Gets a GDrive the volume is located on. Returns NULL if the GVolume is not associated with a GDrive.
Gets a GMount representing the mounted volume. Returns NULL if the GVolume is not mounted.
Returns TRUE if the GVolume can be mounted.
Checks if a GVolume can be ejected.
Mounts a given GVolume. GVolume implementations must emit the aborted signal before completing a mount operation that is aborted while awaiting input from the user through a GMountOperation instance.
Returns the identifier of the given kind, or NULL if the GVolume doesn't have one.
Returns an array strings listing the kinds of identifiers which the GVolume has.
Returns TRUE if the GVolume should be automatically mounted.
Returns the activation root for the GVolume if it is known in advance or NULL if it is not known.
Starts ejecting a GVolume using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Finishes an eject operation using a GMountOperation. Since 2.22.
Gets a key used for sorting GVolume instance or NULL if no such key exists. Since 2.32.
Gets a symbolic GIcon for the GVolume. Since 2.34.

refsect2.condition: deprecated:2.58: Do not use, HAL is deprecated.
refsect2.title: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_HAL_UDI

warning.para: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_HAL_UDI has been deprecated since version 2.58 and should not be used in newly-written code.
Do not use, HAL is deprecated.

refsect2.para: The string used to obtain a Hal UDI with g_volume_get_identifier().

refsect2.title: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_LABEL
refsect2.para: The string used to obtain a filesystem label with g_volume_get_identifier().

refsect2.title: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_NFS_MOUNT
refsect2.para: The string used to obtain a NFS mount with g_volume_get_identifier().

refsect2.title: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UNIX_DEVICE

warning.para: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UNIX_DEVICE is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The string used to obtain a Unix device path with g_volume_get_identifier().

refsect2.title: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_UUID
refsect2.para: The string used to obtain a UUID with g_volume_get_identifier().

refsect2.title: G_VOLUME_IDENTIFIER_KIND_CLASS
refsect2.para: The string used to obtain the volume class with g_volume_get_identifier().
Known volume classes include device and network. Other classes may be added in the future.

This is intended to be used by applications to classify GVolume instances into different sections - for example a file manager or file chooser can use this information to show network volumes under a "Network" heading and device volumes under a "Devices" heading.

refsect2.title: The changed signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the volume has been changed.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last

refsect2.title: The removed signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the GVolume have been removed. If the recipient is holding references to the object they should release them so the object can be finalized.

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Flags: Run Last
